Forty years ago today, Sally Ride launched into history as the first U.S. woman to go to space. An astronaut, physicist, and educator, she inspired generations of women and girls to pursue careers in science and technology. https://go.nasa.gov/3NzVmHU

Suits are set to battery power and today's spacewalk is underway!

This is Hoburg's second spacewalk and Bowen's 10th—tying a record for most spacewalks made by a U.S. astronaut.

Why is Venus so hot?

The planet’s thick CO2-filled atmosphere is great at trapping heat. This creates a runaway greenhouse effect that makes Venus roughly 700°F (389°C) hotter than it would be otherwise. 
@NASAJPL
's Dr. Amy Hofmann gives us the details: https://go.nasa.gov/42FxR4v

Live Now 

Join us for a "guided tour" of our "Eyes on Asteroids" real-time visualization app. Learn how to use the tool and explore the 28,000 known asteroids and comets in our cosmic neighborhood.
Astronauts Frank Rubio and @Astro_Alneyadi are closing the hatch in the @Space_Station's Quest airlock as Steve Bowen and @Astro_Woody prepare to step outside for today's spacewalk.

LIVE: Steve Bowen and @Astro_Woody are installing a new roll-out solar array outside the @Space_Station.

Today's spacewalk is scheduled to start around 8:55am ET (1255 UTC) and run for six hours.
In collaboration with @GoogleArts, @NASAGoddard scientist Dr. Heather Graham sits down with @Astro_Kobi to discuss how we find answers to the age-old question: Is there life beyond Earth?

Why is Venus so hot?

The planet’s thick CO2-filled atmosphere is great at trapping heat. This creates a runaway greenhouse effect that makes Venus roughly 700°F (389°C) hotter than it would be otherwise. @NASAJPL's Dr. Amy Hofmann gives us the details: https://go.nasa.gov/42FxR4v

Join us at 7:30am ET (1130 UTC) on June 15 for another spacewalk! @NASA_Astronauts Steve Bowen and @Astro_Woody will install another roll-out solar array on the @Space_Station, scheduled to start at 8:55am ET (1255 UTC).

My first EVA (Extravehicular Activity) was an incredible life experience. The team in mission control @NASA_Johnson was superb. The 1A power channel is now 10kW more powerful. Looking forward to doing it again this week.

Teamwork makes the dream work! Researchers at @NASAAmes are creating tech to let small satellites work together—without being managed individually by mission controllers. One satellite swarm will fly this summer to test their work in our Starling mission. https://go.nasa.gov/45ZC5qF

Today's #CRS28 cargo launch is being waved off due to high winds in the recovery area. 

Monday's launch attempt is scheduled for 11:47am ET (1547 UTC), with NASA TV coverage beginning at 11:15am ET (1515 UTC).

#MissionToPsyche is on track for launch in October 2023!

An independent review board found JPL’s response to address factors contributing to the mission’s 2022 launch delay has been "world class."

LIVE: Tune in as we review next steps for the Psyche mission, set to launch no earlier than Oct. 2023. The spacecraft will study a metal-rich asteroid of the same name that may be the partial core of a building block of rocky planets in our solar system.

You're looking at 45,000+ galaxies.

This image was taken as part of the JWST Advanced Deep Extragalactic Survey (JADES) — a massive science program that’s revolutionizing what we know about galaxies in the early universe: https://go.nasa.gov/3CdLq0s

Here are the highlights
Dragon flies! @SpaceX's #CRS28 cargo launch lifted off from @NASAKennedy at 11:47am ET (1547 UTC). Learn more about the @ISS_Research it's sending to space: http://go.nasa.gov/43dcbOt

LIVE: We're sending science—and a new set of unrolling solar arrays—to the @Space_Station!

@SpaceX's uncrewed #CRS28 mission is scheduled to launch at 11:47am ET (1547 UTC), weather permitting. Watch with us.

A geyser on Saturn’s moon Enceladus, the #Ax2 all-private astronaut crew depart the @Space_Station, and an independent panel of experts discusses unidentified anomalous phenomena: all this & more, this week at NASA.

Subscribe for more space in your life: http://nasa.gov/subscribe

We're now targeting Sunday, June 4 for the launch of #CRS28, to allow for improving weather conditions and additional vehicle preparations. NASA TV coverage will begin at 11:45am ET (1545 UTC), with launch targeted for 12:12pm (1612 UTC): https://blogs.nasa.gov/crs-28/2023/06/03/weather-40-favorable-for-spacexs-28th-cargo-resupply-launch/…
LIVE: Get the latest details on the launch of @SpaceX’s #CRS28 uncrewed cargo resupply mission to the @Space_Station. Liftoff is currently set for Saturday, June 3, at 12:35pm ET (1635 UTC).

Soon, @SpaceX’s #CRS28 Dragon cargo spacecraft is set to launch food, supplies, scientific experiments, & tech demos to the @Space_Station. Learn about the science aboard, including plant & genetic studies and satellite projects: https://go.nasa.gov/43dcbOt
